GWRCS07001-d-01-15-07-GWR.Narrative: ON JANUARY 15TH, AT 12:30 PM, THE GW 2233 WAS ATTEMPTING TO ASCEND GOVE HILL WITH EIGHT LOADED COVERED HOPPERS ENROUTE TO GREELEY, CO DUE RO THE ACCUMULATION OF SNOW ANS ICE ON THE TRACKS, THE ENGINEER WAS HAVING TROUBLE MAKING THE MOVE. LOCOMOTIVE 4327 WAS AT OFFICERS JUNCTION.  I INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO ASSIST IN SHOVING THE TRAIN OVER THE HILL.  I WAS STANDING AT COUNTY ROAD 13 AWAITING THERETURN MOVEMENT OF 4327.  I COULD SEE THAT AS THE 2233 CROSSED HIGHWAY 34, IT DERAILED.  RADIO COMMUNICATION WAS GIVEN TO THE ENGINEER ON THE 4327 TO STOP THE SHOVING MOVEMENT.  THE 2233 MOVED ON ABOUT TWO CAR LENGTHS FROM THE POINT OF THE DERAILMENT AND THEN FELL OVER ON THE ENGINEER'S SIDE WHEN ITREACHED A SMALL BRIDGE CROSSING A LARGE IRRIGATION DITCH.  UPON REACHING THE GRADE CROSSING TWO BNSF EMPLOYEES REPORTED THAT THEY WERE AT THE CROSSING WHEN THE DERAILMNET OCCURRED.  THEY STATED THATTHE TRAILING END OF THE LOCOMOTIVE CAME IN CONTACT WITH ONE OF THE CEMENT PLANKS, PULLING IT UP FROMTHE ROADBED AND DERAILING THE LOCOMOTIVE. WHEN THE LOCOMOTIVE FELL OVER, CAR NUMBER SRV 5127 CONTINUED TO MOVE A HEAD.  IT MADE CONTACT WITH THE LOCOMOTIVE CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE AL CORNER OF THE CAR.  NUMBER THREE AND FOUR WHEELS DERAILED. THE ENGINEER REPORTED THAT HE HAD HIT HIS KNEE ONTHE CONTROL STAND.  HE DID NOT FEEL THAT HE NEEDED MEDICAL ATTENTION . THE CONDUCTOR FELL TO THE ENGINEER'S SIDE OF THE CAB WHEN IT WENT OVER.  HE REPORTED NO INJURIES AT THE TIME. THE NEXT MORNING H

2007T103-d-01-20-07-BB.Narrative: CSXT TRAIN T70819 WAS OPERATING WESTBOUND ON THE BUCKINGHAM BRANCH RAILROAD DURING THE NIGHT OF JANUARY 19-20, 2006.  AT APPROXIMATELY 0245 HOURS, THE TRAIN PASSED GREENWOOD (MILEPOST CA 198.9), A CARABOUT 60 CARS DEEP IN THE CONSIST, HAD BRAKE RIGGING DRAGGING ON THE BALL OF THE RAIL.  THIS EQUIPMENT WAS POSSIBLY DRAGGING FOR SEVERAL MILES BEFORE MILEPOST CA 198.9.  THE DRAGGING EQUIPMENT APPARENTLY CAUSED A FOLLOWING CAR (CSXT 387566) TO DERAIL A WHEEL.  THIS OCCURRED ON THE HIGH SIDE OF A LEFT HAND CURVE.  AT THE WEST END OF AFTON SIDING (MILEPOST CA 204.1), A SECOND WHEEL DERAILED; THEREWAS SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO THE SWITCH: CLOSURE RAIL PULLED OUT OF PLATES, FROG BOLT BROKEN, FIVE HEELBLOCKS BROKEN, AND CONNECTING RODS BENT CAUSING THE SWITCH POINT TO GAP.  THERE WAS SUSPENSION SPRINGS LEFT AT THE SWITCH LOCATION (INDICATING WHEEL[S] ON THE GROUND).  THE TRAIN PROCEEDED (WITH TWOWHEELS ON THE GROUND) TO MILEPOST CA 207.8 WHERE THREE CARS TOTALLY LEFT THE RAILS AND 7 CARS BEHINDHAD DIFFERING NUMBERS OF WHEELS ON THE GROUND.  TWO BRIDGES, OVER CITY STREETS AND ANOTHER RAILROAD, HAD WALKWAYS ON THE NORTH SIDE OF EACH BRIDGE, TORN OUT.  ONE CAR CAUGHT A SECURITY FENCE AROUND TWO RAILROAD BUILDINGS.  THE EVIDENCE INDICATES THAT THIS CYCLONE FENCE CONTRIBUTED TO THE GENERAL PILE-UP.  THE FENCE APPEARS TO HAVE CAUGHT MATERIAL ON THE GROUND AND PULLED THE CAR TOTALLY OFF THE RAIL.  AT THAT POINT, THE BRAKE AIR LINE WAS BROKEN; THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  AS THE FIRST CAR

I0107-d-01-11-07-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to stop train in clear
I0107-d-01-11-07-PATH.Contributing Accident Cause: Failure to comply with restricted speed or its equivalent not in connection with a block or interloc
I0107-d-01-11-07-PATH.Accident Cause: Failure to stop train in clear
I0107-d-01-11-07-PATH.Narrative:
ON 1/11/07 AT APPROXIMATELY 12:07AM, THE ENGINEER WAS LAYING UP THE 11:57PM HOBOKEN TO WTC TRAIN (LAST MOVE ON HIS 4:10PM X 12:10AM TOUR).  A TOTAL OF 8 PEOPLE WERE ON-BOARD THE TRAIN AND LL WERE LOCATED IN THE HEAD CAR; THE ENGINEER, CONDUCTOR AND 6 PASSENGERS.  

THE ENGINEER PROCEEDED TO THE WTC WITH A 7-CAR CONSIST (718-661-689-610-662-156-608) AND SLOWLY ROLLED THROUGH A RED LIGHT CALL-ON SIGNAL (R14X) WITHOUT OBTAINING PERMISSION FROM THE TRAINMASTER, VIOLATING RULE #101. THE TRAIN WAS TRAVELLING AT APPROXIMATELY 8.97 MPH AND INSTEAD OF DECREASING IN SPEED, ACCELERATED TO APPROXIMATELY11.5 MPH.  WHEN APPROACHING SIGNAL (263Z), A DOUBLE RED LIGHT WAS DISPLAYED, THE TRAIN STOP WAS POINTED IN THE DOWN POSITION INDICATING THAT ANOTHER TRAIN WAS AHEAD AND THAT PERMISSION MUST BE REQUESTED TO PASS THE TRAIN STOP.  HOWEVER, THE ENGINEER ALSO RAN THROUGH A RESTRICTED SIGNAL (263Z) WITHOUT OBTAINING PERMISSION, VIOLATING RULE #253 AND COLLIDING INTO THE REAR OF A 7-CAR CONSIST (875-803-733-739-832-180-827) STORED IN FRONT OF HIS TRAIN.  

EMS, POLICE AND PATH SUPERVISORS RESPONDEDTO THE SCENE AND THREE INDIVIDUALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL: ONE PASSENGER, THE CONDUCTOR AND ONE GENERAL MAINTAINER THAT WAS PERFORMING WORK ON THE STORED TRAIN.  THE ENGINEER WAS TAKEN FOR DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING. ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  DAMAGES WERE ESTIMATED AT $27,701.

CRLCS07004-d-01-20-07-CRL.Narrative: WHILE SHOVING 29 LOADS AND 1 EMPTY SOUTH ON THE CRL MAIN DESCENDING GRADE FROM SOUTH CHICAGO THE 9THTO THE 13TH CAR DERAILED. WSOR 12509 1B AND 1 SET OF WHEELS (UP-RIGHT) WSOR 17132 ALL WHEELS DERAILED (UPRIGHT) WSOR 17628 ALL WHEELS DERAILED (CAR ON SIDE PRODUCT LEAKING) WSOR 17513 ALL WHEELS (CARON ITS SIDE PRODUCT LEAKING) WSOR 12547 1 SET OF WHEELS DERAILED A-END (UPRIGHT). ALL CARS HAD GRAIN AND WERE NON-HAZARDOUS. CONDUCTOR WAS ON THE POINT OF THE TRAIN PROTECTING THE SHOVE WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. CARS WERE WEIGHED AND DETERMINED TO BE OVERLOADED. CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT DETERMINED TO BE THE OVERLOADED CARS.

2007000003-d-01-17-07-PTRA.Narrative: UP JOB LHU19-17 WORKED ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS, DEPARTING WITH 6 CARS AT 11:25 AM, AT APPROXIMATELY 11:45 ITS DRAGGED OUT OF BARBOURS CUT RAMP CROSSING OVER TO THE PTRA MAIN RUNNING TRACK IN THE PROCESS RAN THROUGH THE SWITCH AT ENTERPRISE WHICH WAS STILL LINED FOR MOVEMENT INTO THE SPUR.  THE ENGINEERON THE ITS ENGINE ONCE COMPLETING DRAGGING OUT MADE A REVERSE MOVEMENT BACK TOWARDS THE RAMP, THE ENTERPRISE SWITCH HAD BEEN DAMAGED AND WAS GAPPED ONCE THE REVERSE MOVEMENT HAD BEGUN, THE 4TH CAR (5-PACK OF ARTICULATED STACK CARS) BNSF 238492 WENT THE DIVERGING ROUTE TOWARDS ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS ASWELL AS DERAILING THE 5TH CAR (5-PACK OF ARTICULATED STACK CARS) NOKL 252283, THIS CAR DERAILED TOWARDS THE PTRA  MAIN RUNNING RAIL, AS THE TRACKS WERE PARALLEL AND DIVIRGING AWAY FROM EACH OTHER THETWO CARS PULLED THE TRACK TOGETHER, MOVING THE SPUR TRACK APPROXIMATELY 32 INCHES TOWARDS TO THE PTRA MAIN RUNNING RAIL AND PULLING THE PTRA MAIN RUNNING RAIL APPROXIMATELY 13 INCHES TOWARDS THE SPURTRACK, BREAKING THE RAIL IN TWO PLACES DAMAGING TIES AND A ROADWAY CROSSING ALSO ROLLING ABOUT 130 FOOT OF RAIL.
